intro: Alyssum pateri f. wanense, commonly known as the Wanese alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, round seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
